text:
John (Jack) Carl Scarbath (August 12, 1930December 6, 2020) was a professional American football quarterback in the National Football League (NFL) for the Washington Redskins and Pittsburgh Steelers. He was honored into the College Football Hall of Fame in 1983. Scarbath was born in Baltimore, Maryland.
Scarbath died on December 6, 2020 in Rising Sun, Maryland from congestive heart failure, aged 90.
